channel.title: Im learning how to speak czech, does anyone here also speak it?
channel.description: well im learning how to speak czech. i was wondering if anyone else here speaks it, perhaps you could check this post every couple of days and correct me? all i know now is the alphabet and how to pronounce it.

item.title: Im learning how to speak czech, does anyone here also speak it?
item.dc:creator: @kmb Kmb
item.description:
@kmb wrote:

[quote=“lothy, post:13, topic:41115”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=57618.msg724975#msg724975 date=1167772546]
English isn’t a particularly easy language. In fact, I think it would be a bastard to learn.
[/quote]
So they say. Lucky me, I grew up in an all english speaking environment. And as far as I can tell going by posts on these boards, I’d say most other people here are from english speaking backgrounds… if anyone isn’t, they’re doing a good job so far. :P[/quote]
Actually, English is a piece of cake compared to languages like Swedish (yuck!) and Finnish. For me it was no bitch to learn (well I’m still learning as you can see…). It’s pretty annoying to re-check from the dictionary the meaning of every tenth or so word though, only because every Finnish word has tens of different meanings in English and vice versa.

And on topic:
If you are only going to visit Czech Republic, I could suggest only learning the very basic words like “thank you” and “hello” etc. Of course it’s up to you, if you want to learn a new language just because you’re visiting a new country, nothing stops you i suppose.

Read full topic
item.source: Im learning how to speak czech, does anyone here also speak it?

item.title: Im learning how to speak czech, does anyone here also speak it?
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Well… i learnt a bit of french to go to france… and they all spoke english so i was pissed off… same happened in germany (im pretty good at speaking german) and holland (didnt want to learn dutch) and czech republic ( i only went there for a weekend though so i only spoke to about 20 people :P).

There’ll be some english speaking chaps in czech republic :D.

Read full topic

item.title: Im learning how to speak czech, does anyone here also speak it?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Isn’t Czech one of the really hard ones? Talk about jumping straight into the deep end. That must be like going from only ever speaking english, to trying to write in traditional Chinese… Provided it’s Czech that I’m thinking of.
